parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate.  It promotes the activities of the Ministry of Research, Innovation and Digitization, focusing on the use of EU funds for improving citizen interaction with the state.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its hashtags and message are clearly intended to reach a wide audience in Romania.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is not to influence the vote for any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections.  It promotes government initiatives and the use of EU funds. While indirectly related to the general political landscape, it lacks a direct call to action related to voting for any specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of government communication, similar to a public service announcement, aiming to inform citizens about government programs and initiatives. It does not contain biased opinions or attempts to sway public opinion towards a specific political outcome.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>953829533273832</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by the Ministry of Research, Innovation and Digitization, promotes government initiatives related to improving citizen interaction with the state using EU funds.  It does not mention any parliamentary candidates or parties, nor does it explicitly encourage voting for or against any specific candidate. The content is informative and focuses on the government's actions, not on influencing electoral choices.  The hashtags used (#ȘtiațiCă, #MCID, #viitoruleacum) are general and do not directly relate to the parliamentary elections.  The post's objective is to inform the public about government programs, not to sway votes.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCID</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
